summary: Timezone issue analysis
description:
For date type extended fields in est time zone (machine time zone set in ushc) the final date that is getting saved in the db is incorrect.

like for example {{2025-02-05}} date gets converted {{2025-02-04}} because of data string conversion code block in DataAdapter



* *IST (Indian Standard Time)*
IST = UTC + 5:30
* *GMT (Greenwich Mean Time)*
GMT = UTC
* *EST (Eastern Standard Time)*
EST = UTC - 5:00
* *CST (Central Standard Time)*
CST = UTC - 6:00

as this essentially only impacts the timezones which are behind UTC it is only impacting uscrm & ushcrm.

we need a code fix which uses the org configuration to not assume the default timezone as UTC

Please find the details below.Vulnerability:Ingress NGINX deploys an admission controller within its pod, designed to validate incoming ingress objects before they are deployed. By default, admission controllers are accessible over the network without authentication, making them a highly appealing attack vector. When the Ingress-NGINX admission controller processes an incoming ingress object, it constructs an NGINX configuration from it and then validates it using the NGINX binary. Vulnerability in this phase that allows injecting an arbitrary NGINX configuration remotely, by sending a malicious ingress object directly to the admission controller through the network.  During the configuration validation phase, the injected NGINX configuration causes the NGINX validator to execute code, allowing remote code execution (RCE) on the Ingress NGINX Controller’s pod. Affected Versions< v1.11.0v1.11.0 - 1.11.4v1.12.0Mitigation:Update to the latest version of Ingress NGINX Controller. This vulnerability is fixed in Ingress NGINX Controller version 1.12.1 and 1.11.5.Ensure the admission webhook endpoint is not exposed externally.If you can’t upgrade immediately, consider one of these mitigations:If you have installed ingress-nginx using Helm, reinstall with controller.admissionWebhooks.enabled=falseUnder the scope of  Capillary Infrastructure:The controller version that we are running is 1.3.1.By default admission webhook is disabled in all clusters.Even though temporary fix is in place we will in need upgrade the ingress controller version as a permanent fix. We will raise ticket to Facet's for the same.We have received the alert mail from AWS for Cap-cloudmanagement and professional services account. I have already informed the respective PoC's regarding the same. In capcloudmanagment, AWS reported this for a demo eks cluster for Facet's. # *Identify and set fraudulent member activities rules and thresholds:*
## Refer to fraud suspected and fraud confirmed score and benchmark tables below.
## Test that OOTB fraud rules and thresholds can be configured for monitoring member activities during their visits to MyStays and Accordia properties.
### Transaction Amount Limit - The system will trigger transactions having an amount more than the predefined threshold.
### Transactions on 1 account per day - The maximum number of transactions in a day should be less than a predefined critical threshold.
### Transaction per Week - The maximum number of transactions in a week should be less than a predefined critical threshold.
### Transactions in two zones 6 hours - Transactions happening in 2 different zones on the same day or every 6 hours
#### Customers having transactions more than 1 in a day in different zones are prone to be tagged as fraud. There would be very few customers with purchases in 2 different regions on the same day.
### Redemption on 1 account per day - The number of times the customer has redeemed points should be more than the predefined value to mark fraud.
### Total Points Redeemed  - If the total points redeemed by the customer is more than a critical value, he is more prone to fraud.
## Test that each fraud rule can be configured with a weight of 0-1.
### The defined weight  is given when the count or amount being inspected is +greater than+ the threshold defined.
## Test that fraud score and benchmark can be configured.
### Total fraud score is the sum of the member’s fraud weight after each member's activity is evaluated.
### Test that the 'Critical Fraud Score' can defined. The 'Critical Fraud Score' is the fraud benchmark.
